name: TheAtlantic
text: The "Gone Girl" author Gillian Flynn doesn’t usually write ensemble thrillers on a global scale. But with her new series "Utopia," she got to explore one of her obsessions: the conspiracy theory. @shirklesxp reports: https://t.co/WclR3uS6Ld

name: TheAtlantic
text: Companies such as Nike, Uber, and Amazon, fresh off a summer of marketing themselves on anti-racism, have found something new to usher their customers toward, writes @amandamull: the voting booth. https://t.co/4UtKhOoGP5

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"Usually debates don’t really 'matter.' Tonight’s encounter is a moment of high drama." Our staff writer @JamesFallows shares his moment-by-moment analysis of the first presidential debate. 
https://t.co/HCOCuGbXr6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Only if the Senate performs a genuine, thorough review of the president’s nominee for a lifetime appointment to the highest court in the land, though, is this key piece of our system of checks and balances meaningful," @NoahBookbinder writes: https://t.co/JCVqARonx2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hugh Price and his family fought for him to be one of the first Black students at an all-white high school in Washington, D.C. Once he was there, he “couldn’t wait for it to be over.” One of five pieces from our special project #TheFirsts, by @AdamHSays: https://t.co/mls4O41hgJ
